title: Mathematics Problem-Solving Enhancement Course Utilizing Brain-Computer Interface-Based Neurofeedback Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics knowledge and understanding of BCI/neurofeedback concepts
context.additional_context: Application of a personalized training system that adjusts problem difficulty by analyzing individual learners' cognitive load in real time

learning_goals: Learners can monitor their cognitive states in real-time based on brain activity data measured via BCI devices
Learners can select optimal math problem difficulties and develop solution strategies through ZPD (Zone of Proximal Development) analysis
Learners can achieve over 20% score improvement in standardized math achievement tests after 4 weeks of training
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
